intro: Coriandrum tordylium, commonly known as the common coriander, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates. Its seeds, known as cumin, are widely used in culinary applications and traditional medicine. The plant's aromatic properties are due to the presence of essential oils, including limonene and linalool.
